Docs.summary: Global methods and constants for using CoreMidi.
The number of MIDI devices in the system (do not confused with external connected devices).

Docs.summary: Returns an object representing the specified MIDI device.
Docs.returns: An instance of MidiDevice, or null on error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class CoreMidi.MidiDevice GetExternalDevice(valuetype System.nint deviceIndex) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an object representing the specified external MIDI device.
Docs.returns: An instance of MidiDevice, or null on error.

Docs.summary: Represents the value associated with the constant MIDINetworkBonjourServiceType
Docs.remarks: You can pass this type to to find MIDI devices available over bonjour.

Docs.summary: Notification raised when the MIDI network has changed.

remarks.para: This constant can be used with the to register a listener for this notification. This is an NSString instead of a string, because these values can be used as tokens in some native libraries instead of being used purely for their actual string content. The 'notification' parameter to the callback contains extra information that is specific to the notification type.
If you want to subscribe to this notification, you can use the convenience . method which offers strongly typed access to the parameters of the notification.
The following example shows how to use the strongly typed Notifications class, to take the guesswork out of the available properties in the notification:
The following example shows how to use the notification with the DefaultCenter API:

Docs.remarks: This stops the MIDI subsystems and forces it to be reinitialized.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of sources in the system.
Docs.remarks: Use the to fetch a specific source (represented by a MidiEndpoint).
